Mina Protocol Stable Debian Repository

Official Debian repository for stable Mina packages. Contains only stable packages for devnet and mainnet networks.

Supported Distributions

  • Ubuntu Focal (20.04 LTS)
  • Ubuntu Noble (24.04 LTS) *
  • Debian Bullseye (11)
  • Debian Bookworm (12) *
* Supported starting from Mina version 3.1.0 and newer

Available Packages

Package Network Debian Name
Mina Node Mainnet mina
Mina Rosetta Node Mainnet mina-rosetta
Archive Node Mainnet mina-archive
Archive Node Devnet mina-archive-devnet
Mina Node Devnet mina-devnet
Mina Rosetta Node Devnet mina-rosetta-devnet

Release Channels

Choose the right channel for your deployment needs, from production-ready stable releases to cutting-edge development builds.

✓

Stable

Production Ready
Target Network
Mainnet
Risk Level
Minimal
Battle-tested releases with enterprise-grade reliability. These packages represent the gold standard for Mina Protocol deployments, having undergone extensive validation across multiple environments, comprehensive security audits, and thorough community testing. Each release includes formal verification, performance benchmarks, and complete documentation.
🏛️ Production Use
Recommended for mainnet validators, block producers, and mission-critical infrastructure
🔒 Security Audited
Full security review with cryptographic validation and penetration testing
📋 Migration Support
Comprehensive upgrade guides with backward compatibility guarantees
⚡ Performance Optimized
Optimized for throughput, memory usage, and network efficiency
β

Beta

Release Candidate
Target Network
Mainnet
Risk Level
Low
Pre-production releases for early adopters. These packages are promoted from alpha after successful devnet validation and represent feature-complete implementations ready for final testing. Ideal for organizations that want to evaluate upcoming features and provide feedback before stable release.
🚀 Early Access
First access to new features and protocol improvements
🧪 Testing Focus
Suitable for mainnet testing environments and staging deployments
📊 Performance Data
Help collect real-world performance metrics and edge case scenarios
🔄 Regular Updates
Frequent updates with bug fixes and feature refinements
α

Alpha

Early Testing
Target Network
Devnet
Risk Level
Medium
Cutting-edge development builds for research and testing. These packages contain the latest experimental features, protocol changes, and performance optimizations. Essential for protocol researchers, core developers, and community members contributing to Mina's evolution. Not suitable for production use.
🔬 Research Focus
Experimental consensus mechanisms and cryptographic improvements
⚠️ Known Issues
May contain bugs and breaking changes - use with caution
🏗️ Protocol Development
Test new protocol features and network upgrade mechanisms
👥 Community Testing
Help validate features before promotion to beta channel

Latest Versions

Current release versions available for each channel with installation commands.

✓

Stable

Production
v3.1.0

Switch to stable channel:

echo "deb https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye stable" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.list

Then install specific version:

apt-get update && apt-get install -y mina=3.1.0*
  • mina=3.1.0* - Mainnet node
  • mina-devnet=3.1.0* - Devnet node
  • mina-archive=3.1.0* - Archive node
  • mina-rosetta=3.1.0* - Rosetta API
β

Beta

Release Candidate
v3.2.0-beta2

Switch to beta channel:

echo "deb https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye beta" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.list

Then install specific version:

apt-get update && apt-get install -y mina=3.2.0-beta2*
  • mina=3.2.0-beta2* - Mainnet node (beta)
  • mina-devnet=3.2.0-beta2* - Devnet node (beta)
  • mina-archive=3.2.0-beta2* - Archive node (beta)
  • mina-rosetta=3.2.0-beta2* - Rosetta API (beta)
α

Alpha

Early Testing
v3.2.0-alpha1

Switch to alpha channel:

echo "deb https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye alpha" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.list

Then install specific version:

apt-get update && apt-get install -y mina=3.2.0-alpha1*
  • mina=3.2.0-alpha1* - Mainnet node (alpha)
  • mina-devnet=3.2.0-alpha1* - Devnet node (alpha)
  • mina-archive=3.2.0-alpha1* - Archive node (alpha)
  • mina-rosetta=3.2.0-alpha1* - Rosetta API (alpha)

Debian Installation Guide

To install Mina stable packages through the APT repository, follow these steps:

1Install Dependencies (Optional)

Install required dependencies if not already present:

apt-get install -y lsb-release ca-certificates wget gnupg

Update package cache:

apt-get update

2Import Repository Signing Key

Download and install the Mina repository signing key:

wget -q https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com/repo-signing-key.gpg -O /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/minaprotocol.gpg

Update package cache after adding the key:

apt-get update

3Add Mina APT Repository

Add the Mina stable APT repository:

echo "deb https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye stable" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.list
Distribution Codenames: Replace bullseye with your distribution codename.

Auto-detect your codename:
lsb_release -c
Or use these common codenames:
  • Ubuntu 20.04: focal
  • Ubuntu 24.04: noble
  • Debian 11: bullseye
  • Debian 12: bookworm

Switching between stable/beta/alpha channels:
To switch channels, modify the entry in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.list:
  • Stable: deb https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye stable
  • Beta: deb https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye beta
  • Alpha: deb https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye alpha

4Install Mina Package

Update package list and install Mina:

apt-get update
apt-get install -y mina
Note: For other packages, replace mina with the appropriate package name from the table above (e.g., mina-devnet, mina-archive, etc.).
